FuncDef:
The netstream timeout tcp-session command configures the aging of NetStream flows according to the FIN flag or the RST flag in the TCP packet header.
The undo netstream timeout tcp-session command restores the default setting. The netstream timeout tcp-session command configures the aging of NetStream flows according to the FIN flag or the RST flag in the TCP packet header. The undo netstream timeout tcp-session command restores the default setting. By default, NetStream flows are not aged according to the FIN or RST flag in the TCP packet header.
CLIs: netstream timeout { ip | ipv6 | vxlaninner-ip } tcp-session
undo netstream timeout { ip | ipv6 | vxlaninner-ip } tcp-session

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the inner packet of the IPv4 type for VXLAN packets.
-

ExtraInfo: The FIN or RST flag in a TCP packet indicates that the TCP connection is terminated. When receiving a packet with the FIN or RST flag, the device immediately ages the corresponding NetStream flow. If this command is not run, NetStream flows are aged by following other criteria, for example, inactive aging time or bytes overflow.
